titles.title: Developmental Disabilities Assistance and Bill of Rights Act Amendments of 1996
To amend the Developmental Disabilities Assistance and Bill of Rights Act to extend the Act, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Commerce. H. Rept. 104-719.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 384.

action.text: Mr. Frisa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/23/1996--Introduced. Developmental Disabilities Assistance and Bill of Rights Act Amendments of 1996 - Amends the Developmental Disabilities Assistance and Bill of Rights Act to extend it through FY 1999. Reauthorizes appropriations for: (1) allotments for States; (2) protection and advocacy of individual rights; (3) university-affiliated programs; and (4) projects of national significance.
